topic: Blood Circulation in the Human Body

stepAnalyses.stepDesc: Imagine a sprawling, complex city where every single inhabitant needs a fresh supply of resources and waste removal every few seconds. If delivery stops for just a few minutes, entire districts collapse. Your body is that city. How does a single, fist-sized organ, the heart, manage to continuously deliver oxygen and nutrients to trillions of cells across a vast, intricate network, and remove their waste? What happens if even a tiny part of this 'delivery service' fails? Visualize a single brain cell, vibrant and active one moment, then dimming and ceasing as its oxygen supply vanishes – a stark contrast to the relentless, unseen rhythm sustaining life. This seemingly simple biological pump performs an awe-inspiring, non-stop feat.

rawActions.text: Imagine a sprawling, complex city where every single inhabitant needs a fresh su
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Overview of blood flow throughout the body.
The heart pumps blood through a cycle of contraction and relaxation.
Arteries carry blood away from the heart; veins carry blood back.
Capillaries facilitate exchange of oxygen and nutrients.
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
A simplified representation of the human heart.
The heart consists of four chambers: two atria and two ventricles.
Blood flows through the heart and into the lungs and body.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <circle id="heart_circle" r="0.01" fill="#e74c3c"/>
    <circle id="blue_circle" r="0.01" fill="#3498db"/>
    <path id="arrow" d="M0,0 L0.02,0 L0.02,0.01 L0.03,0.005 L0.02,0 L0.02,-0.01 L0,-0.01 Z" fill="black"/>
  </defs>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.05" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Blood Circulation (Heart Pulse)</text>

  <!-- Heart Shape -->
  <path d="M0.5,0.2 C0.3,0.2 0.2,0.4 0.2,0.5 C0.2,0.7 0.4,0.8 0.5,0.9 C0.6,0.8 0.8,0.7 0.8,0.5 C0.8,0.4 0.7,0.2 0.5,0.2 Z"
        fill="#f5b7b1" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005"/>

  <!-- Right Atrium -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Right Atrium</text>
  <circle cx="0.3" cy="0.5" r="0.03" fill="#3498db" opacity="0.8">
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="0.8;0.3;0.8" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </circle>

  <!-- Tricuspid Valve -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.6" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tricuspid Valve</text>
  <path d="M0.3,0.55 L0.3,0.65" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.005">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0.005;0.001;0.005" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>

  <!-- Right Ventricle -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.8" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Right Ventricle</text>
  <circle cx="0.3" cy="0.7" r="0.05" fill="#3498db" opacity="0.8">
    <animate attributeName="r" values="0.05;0.03;0.05" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </circle>

  <!-- Pulmonary Valve -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.9" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Pulmonary Valve</text>
  <path d="M0.3,0.85 L0.3,0.95" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.005">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0.005;0.001;0.005" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>

  <!-- Pulmonary Artery -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.97" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Pulmonary Artery</text>
  <path d="M0.3,0.95 L0.3,1.0" stroke="#3498db" stroke-width="0.01"/>

  <!-- Left Atrium -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Left Atrium</text>
  <circle cx="0.7" cy="0.5" r="0.03" fill="#e74c3c" opacity="0.8">
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="0.8;0.3;0.8" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </circle>

  <!-- Mitral Valve -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.6" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Mitral Valve</text>
  <path d="M0.7,0.55 L0.7,0.65" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.005">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0.005;0.001;0.005" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>

  <!-- Left Ventricle -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.8" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Left Ventricle</text>
  <circle cx="0.7" cy="0.7" r="0.05" fill="#e74c3c" opacity="0.8">
    <animate attributeName="r" values="0.05;0.03;0.05" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </circle>

  <!-- Aortic Valve -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.9" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Aortic Valve</text>
  <path d="M0.7,0.85 L0.7,0.95" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.005">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0.005;0.001;0.005" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>

  <!-- Aorta -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.97" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Aorta</text>
  <path d="M0.7,0.95 L0.7,1.0" stroke="#e74c3c" stroke-width="0.01"/>

  <!-- Pulmonary Veins -->
  <text x="0.7" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Pulmonary Veins</text>
  <path d="M0.7,0.2 L0.7,0.3" stroke="#e74c3c" stroke-width="0.01"/>
  
  <!-- Superior Vena Cava -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Superior Vena Cava</text>
    <path d="M0.3,0.2 L0.3,0.3" stroke="#3498db" stroke-width="0.01"/>

    <!-- Inferior Vena Cava -->
  <text x="0.3" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d" transform="translate(0,0.4)">Inferior Vena Cava</text>
    <path d="M0.3,0.2 L0.3,0.3" stroke="#3498db" stroke-width="0.01" transform="translate(0,0.4)"/>

  <!-- Legend -->
  <rect x="0.1" y="0.1" width="0.1" height="0.02" fill="#e74c3c"/>
  <text x="0.22" y="0.115" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Oxygenated Blood</text>
  <rect x="0.1" y="0.15" width="0.1" height="0.02" fill="#3498db"/>
  <text x="0.22" y="0.165" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Deoxygenated Blood</text>

</svg>

<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

  <text x="0.5" y="0.45" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#c0392b">Capillary</text>

  <use href="#tissue_cell" x="0.75" y="0.2"/>
   <text x="0.825" y="0.2" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#2c3e50">Tissue Cell</text>
  <use href="#tissue_cell" x="0.1" y="0.7"/>
   <text x="0.175" y="0.92" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#2c3e50">Tissue Cell</text>
  <use href="#tissue_cell" x="0.75" y="0.7"/>
   <text x="0.825" y="0.92" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#2c3e50">Tissue Cell</text>

  <!-- Red Blood Cells -->
  <use href="#red_blood_cell" x="-0.1" y="0.55">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 1"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#red_blood_cell" x="-0.1" y="0.55">

  </use>
  <use href="#red_blood_cell" x="-0.1" y="0.55">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 1" begin="2s"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Oxygen Diffusion -->
  <use href="#oxygen" x="0.2" y="0.5">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.5;0.3;0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#oxygen" x="0.8" y="0.5">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.5;0.3;0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="1s"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Nutrient Diffusion -->
  <use href="#nutrient" x="0.3" y="0.5">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.5;0.3;0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0.5s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#nutrient" x="0.7" y="0.5">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.5;0.3;0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="1.5s"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Carbon Dioxide Diffusion -->
  <use href="#carbon_dioxide" x="0.25" y="0.3">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.3;0.5;0.3" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" />

  <!-- Labels -->

</svg>

rawActions.text: The Impact of Blood Circulation on Neurons
Oxygen Deprivation leads to cellular stress and dysfunction.
Arterial blood supply is crucial for neuronal health.
Cellular respiration is impaired without oxygen, reducing energy production.

  </defs>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.05" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Blood Circulation</text>

  <!-- Artery -->
  <path d="M 0.1,0.2 L 0.7,0.2" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  <path d="M 0.1,0.3 L 0.7,0.3" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  <text x="0.4" y="0.18" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Artery</text>

  <!-- Capillary -->
  <path d="M 0.7,0.25 L 0.9,0.25" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none"/>
  <text x="0.8" y="0.23" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Capillary</text>

  <!-- Tissue Cells -->
  <rect x="0.9" y="0.2" width="0.05" height="0.05" fill="#27ae60"/>
  <text x="0.925" y="0.23" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.008" fill="white">Cell</text>
  <rect x="0.9" y="0.3" width="0.05" height="0.05" fill="#27ae60"/>
  <text x="0.925" y="0.33" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.008" fill="white">Cell</text>

  <!-- RBC with Oxygen and Nutrients -->
  <use href="#rbc" x="0.1" y="0.25">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6"/>
    <use href="#oxygen" x="0.01" y="0.01"/>
    <use href="#nutrient" x="-0.01" y="-0.01"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0.1" y="0.25">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="1s"/>
    <use href="#oxygen" x="0.01" y="0.01"/>
    <use href="#nutrient" x="-0.01" y="-0.01"/>
  </use>

    <use href="#rbc" x="0.1" y="0.25">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="2s"/>
    <use href="#oxygen" x="0.01" y="0.01"/>
    <use href="#nutrient" x="-0.01" y="-0.01"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Oxygen Diffusion -->
    <animateMotion id="o2_1" dur="1s" repeatCount="1" begin="3s" path="M 0,0 L 0.2,0" fill="freeze"/>
    <animate attributeName="opacity" from="1" to="0" dur="1s" begin="3s" repeatCount="1" fill="freeze" />

    <use href="#oxygen" x="0.75" y="0.25">
      <animateMotion id="o2_2" dur="1s" repeatCount="1" begin="3s" path="M 0,0 L 0.2,0" fill="freeze"/>
      <animate attributeName="opacity" from="1" to="0" dur="1s" begin="3s" repeatCount="1" fill="freeze" />
    </use>

  <!-- Nutrient Diffusion -->
  <use href="#nutrient" x="0.75" y="0.25">
    <animateMotion id="n_1" dur="1s" repeatCount="1" begin="3s" path="M 0,0 L 0.2,0.05" fill="freeze"/>
    <animate attributeName="opacity" from="1" to="0" dur="1s" begin="3s" repeatCount="1" fill="freeze" />
  </use>

    <!-- Oxygen Diffusion -->
    <use href="#oxygen" x="0.75" y="0.25">
      <animateMotion id="o2_3" dur="1s" repeatCount="1" begin="3s" path="M 0,0 L 0.2,-0.05" fill="freeze"/>
      <animate attributeName="opacity" from="1" to="0" dur="1s" begin="3s" repeatCount="1" fill="freeze" />
    </use>


  <text x="0.5" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Red Blood Cells (RBC) flow with Oxygen and Nutrients</text>
  <text x="0.925" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tissue Cells absorb Oxygen and Nutrients</text>
</svg>

stepAnalyses.stepDesc: Let's build a foundational mental model. Think of your circulatory system as a vast, interconnected network of fluid-filled pipes, with the heart as a remarkably efficient, two-sided pump. On one side, it pushes 'fresh' fluid (oxygenated blood) into the city's main supply lines (arteries), which branch into smaller and smaller delivery routes (arterioles, capillaries). On the other side, it simultaneously pulls 'spent' fluid (deoxygenated, waste-rich blood) from the return routes (venules, veins) back to a processing plant (the lungs for oxygen, kidneys for waste). Visualize a simple hydraulic system: a hand pump driving colored fluid through transparent tubes, clearly demonstrating one-way flow maintained by simple 'check valves' and the continuous cycle of push-and-pull.

rawActions.text: Let's build a foundational mental model. Think of your circulatory system as a v
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Simplified representation of the heart pumping blood to the lungs and body.
Detail of the heart showing major vessels.
Full body representation of arteries and veins.
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Overview of heart chambers and basic flow.
Detailed anatomy of heart showing valves.
Blood Vessel Comparison: Artery, Capillary, Vein
Arteries have thick walls to withstand high pressure from the heart's pumping action.
Capillaries have very thin walls to facilitate gas and nutrient exchange.
Veins have thinner walls and valves to prevent backflow of blood.
The varying number of tissue layers reflects the different functions of each vessel type.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <!-- Blood particle definition -->
    <circle id="bloodParticle" r="0.01" fill="#2980b9"/>
  </defs>

  <!-- Background -->
  <rect width="1" height="1" fill="#ecf0f1"/>

  <!-- Vein walls -->
  <path d="M 0.1,0.2 L 0.9,0.2" stroke="#777" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none"/>
  <path d="M 0.1,0.8 L 0.9,0.8" stroke="#777" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none"/>

  <!-- Valve leaflets -->
  <path id="leaflet1" d="M 0.5,0.5 L 0.4,0.3 L 0.4,0.7 Z" fill="#95a5a6" stroke="#777" stroke-width="0.003">
    <animate attributeName="d" values="M 0.5,0.5 L 0.4,0.3 L 0.4,0.7 Z; M 0.5,0.5 L 0.35,0.5 L 0.4,0.7 Z; M 0.5,0.5 L 0.4,0.3 L 0.4,0.7 Z" dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>
  <path id="leaflet2" d="M 0.5,0.5 L 0.6,0.3 L 0.6,0.7 Z" fill="#95a5a6" stroke="#777" stroke-width="0.003">
    <animate attributeName="d" values="M 0.5,0.5 L 0.6,0.3 L 0.6,0.7 Z; M 0.5,0.5 L 0.65,0.5 L 0.6,0.7 Z; M 0.5,0.5 L 0.6,0.3 L 0.6,0.7 Z" dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </path>

  <!-- Blood flow animation -->
  <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.1" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.4"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.1" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.4" begin="0.5s"/>
  </use>
    <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.1" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.4" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.6" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.2" begin="0s"/>
  <animate attributeName="opacity" values="1;0;0" dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </use>
    <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.6" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.2" begin="0.5s"/>
  <animate attributeName="opacity" values="1;0;0" dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </use>
      <use href="#bloodParticle" x="0.6" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.2" begin="1s"/>
  <animate attributeName="opacity" values="1;0;0" dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Labels -->
  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Venous Valve Animation</text>
  <text x="0.25" y="0.35" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Blood Flow (Forward)</text>
  <text x="0.75" y="0.35" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Blood Attempting Backflow</text>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.9" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Valve Leaflets</text>

</svg>

stepAnalyses.stepDesc: Now, let's quantify this flow. Blood circulation isn't just 'happening'; it's governed by precise physical principles. We can define 'Cardiac Output' as the total volume of blood pumped by the heart per minute, calculated as (Heart Rate × Stroke Volume). Visualize fluid moving through a section of pipe: the faster the pump cycles (heart rate) and the bigger each individual push (stroke volume), the greater the total flow. Next, introduce 'Pressure Gradients': blood always flows from areas of high pressure (just after the heart's forceful contraction) to areas of lower pressure (as it returns to the heart). Visually demonstrate this with colored pressure maps overlayed onto the circulatory network, and introduce the concept of 'Resistance' – how factors like the narrowness or length of a vessel, and the viscosity of the blood, impact the ease of flow (e.g., illustrate how a small reduction in vessel radius has a dramatic, cubic effect on resistance according to Poiseuille's Law).

rawActions.text: Now, let's quantify this flow. Blood circulation isn't just 'happening'; it's go
Cardiac Output (CO) is the volume of blood pumped by the heart per minute.
Number of heartbeats per minute, influenced by activity and health.
Volume of blood ejected from the left ventricle per beat.
Cardiac Output calculation with example values.
Factors like exercise, stress, and medications can affect CO.
Understanding these variables is critical for assessing cardiovascular health.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <g id="bloodCell">
      <circle r="0.015" fill="#e74c3c"/>
    </g>
    <path id="flowPath" d="M 0.1 0.5 L 0.9 0.5"/>
  </defs>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Blood Circulation Model</text>

  <rect x="0.2" y="0.3" width="0.2" height="0.4" fill="#ecf0f1" stroke="#34495e" stroke-width="0.005"/>
  <rect x="0.22" y="0.32" width="0.16" height="0.36" fill="#ffffff"/>

  <path d="M 0.4 0.5 L 0.5 0.5" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.01"/>
  <path d="M 0.1 0.5 L 0.2 0.5" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.01"/>
  <path d="M 0.5 0.5 L 0.9 0.5" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.01"/>

  <circle cx="0.3" cy="0.5" r="0.05" fill="#3498db">
    <animate attributeName="cy" values="0.5; 0.4; 0.5" dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
  </circle>
  <text x="0.3" y="0.25" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Heart (Pump)</text>

  <use href="#bloodCell">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1 0 L 0.4 0"/>
    <animate attributeName="x" values="0.2; 0.3" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
    <animate attributeName="y" values="0.5; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
  </use>

  <use href="#bloodCell">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.5 0 L 0.9 0"/>
    <animate attributeName="x" values="0.4; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
    <animate attributeName="y" values="0.5; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
  </use>

  <use href="#bloodCell">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1 0 L 0.4 0"/>
    <animateMotion begin="1s" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1 0 L 0.4 0"/>
     <animate attributeName="x" values="0.2; 0.3" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
    <animate attributeName="y" values="0.5; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
  </use>

  <use href="#bloodCell">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.5 0 L 0.9 0"/>
    <animateMotion begin="1s" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.5 0 L 0.9 0"/>
    <animate attributeName="x" values="0.4; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
    <animate attributeName="y" values="0.5; 0.5" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum"/>
  </use>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.8" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Blood Cells flowing left to right</text>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.9" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Simulated Cardiac Output</text>
</svg>

rawActions.text: Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Simplified representation of the heart and major blood vessels.
Color gradient represents pressure change from arteries to veins.
Focus on the left side of the heart and its connection to the aorta.
Gas exchange occurs in the capillaries.
Veins and Return to the Heart (Right Side)
Blood returns to the right side of the heart via the veins.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="pressureGradient" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#e74c3c;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#3498db;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>

    <g id="rbc">
      <circle r="0.015" fill="#e74c3c"/>
      <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="white" dy="0.004">RBC</text>
    </g>
  </defs>

  <rect width="0.8" height="0.1" x="0.1" y="0.45" fill="url(#pressureGradient)" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005"/>

  <path d="M 0.1,0.45 L 0.9,0.45" stroke="none" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  <path d="M 0.1,0.55 L 0.9,0.55" stroke="none" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>

  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="0s" />
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="0.5s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="1.5s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="2s"/>
  </use>

  <path d="M 0.92,0.5 L 0.98,0.5" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.005" marker-end="url(#arrowhead)"/>
  <defs>
    <marker id="arrowhead" markerWidth="10" markerHeight="7" refX="0" refY="3.5" orient="auto">
      <polygon points="0 0, 10 3.5, 0 7" fill="black" />
    </marker>
  </defs>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Blood Circulation</text>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.2" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Red Blood Cells (RBC) flow due to Pressure Gradient</text>
  <text x="0.2" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#e74c3c">High Pressure</text>
  <text x="0.8" y="0.4" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#3498db">Low Pressure</text>
  <text x="0.95" y="0.58" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="black">Pressure Drop</text>
</svg>

rawActions.text: Vessel diameter and length significantly influence resistance to blood flow.
Larger Radius, Shorter Length = Lower Resistance
Smaller Radius, Longer Length = Higher Resistance
Resistance is inversely proportional to the fourth power of the radius.
Q: Flow rate, ΔP: Pressure difference, r: Vessel radius, η: Viscosity, L: Vessel length
r⁴ term highlights the radius's impact on flow rate.
Flow rate is highly sensitive to changes in vessel radius.
Particle flow is slower in narrower vessels.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <g id="rbc">
      <circle r="0.015" fill="#e74c3c"/>
    </g>
  </defs>
  
  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Blood Circulation & Vasoconstriction</text>
  
  <text x="0.25" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Normal Vessel Radius</text>
  <text x="0.75" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Constricted Vessel Radius</text>
  
  <!-- Normal Vessel -->
  <path id="normalVesselTop" d="M 0.1,0.4 L 0.4,0.4" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  <path id="normalVesselBottom" d="M 0.1,0.46 L 0.4,0.46" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  
  <!-- Constricted Vessel -->
  <path id="constrictedVesselTop" d="M 0.6,0.4 L 0.9,0.4" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  <path id="constrictedVesselBottom" d="M 0.6,0.46 L 0.9,0.46" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
  
  <!-- Normal Vessel Flow -->
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.43">
    <animateMotion dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1,0 H 0.3,0"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.43">
    <animateMotion dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1,0 H 0.3,0" begin="0.5s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.43">
    <animateMotion dur="2s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.1,0 H 0.3,0" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
  
  <!-- Constricted Vessel Flow -->
  <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.43">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.6,0 H 0.3,0"/>
  </use>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.43">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0.6,0 H 0.3,0" begin="1.5s"/>
  </use>
  
    <path d="M 0.4,0.43 L 0.6,0.43" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.005" stroke-dasharray="0.01 0.01">
        <animate attributeName="d" values="M 0.4,0.43 L 0.6,0.43; M 0.4,0.43 L 0.6,0.43" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
    </path>
  
  <text x="0.25" y="0.55" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#27ae60">Normal Flow Rate</text>
  <text x="0.75" y="0.55" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#e74c3c">Reduced Flow Rate</text>
  
</svg>

stepAnalyses.stepDesc: The system is more complex than a single loop. We have two distinct, but interconnected, circuits: the 'Pulmonary Circulation' (a short, low-pressure loop to the lungs for gas exchange) and the 'Systemic Circulation' (a long, high-pressure loop to the rest of the body). Visualize these as separate but coordinated journeys. Dive into the 'Capillary Exchange': how does oxygen actually leave the tiny vessels and enter cells, and how do waste products move in? Imagine a microscopic dance of diffusion and filtration, where the thin walls of capillaries allow selective 'leaking' and exchange. Explore the sophisticated regulatory mechanisms: how your nervous system can instantly constrict or dilate vessels (vasomotor control) to redistribute blood flow, or how hormonal signals maintain blood pressure, adapting to situations like standing up quickly or intense exercise. Animate baroreceptors in major arteries sensing pressure changes and triggering neural responses to maintain equilibrium.

rawActions.text: The system is more complex than a single loop. We have two distinct, but interco
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Visual 1: Overview of the Circulatory System
Simplified representation showing the central role of the heart.
Blood travels from the right ventricle to the lungs to gain oxygen.
Blood travels from the left ventricle to the body, delivering oxygen.
Combined diagram showing both pulmonary and systemic circulations.
Capillary Exchange: Oxygen and Carbon Dioxide
Cross-section of a capillary showing the endothelial wall.
Oxygen molecules (O₂) diffusing out of the capillary.
Visual 4: Carbon Dioxide and Waste Diffusion
Carbon dioxide (CO₂) and waste products diffusing into the capillary.
Complete capillary exchange: O₂ out, CO₂ and waste in.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <g id="redBloodCell">
      <circle cx="0" cy="0" r="0.015" fill="#e74c3c"/>
      <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="white" dy="0.004" x="0" y="0">RBC</text>
    </g>
    <g id="oxygen">
      <circle cx="0" cy="0" r="0.005" fill="#f06292"/>
      <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.005" fill="black" dy="0.002" x="0" y="0">O2</text>
    </g>
    <g id="carbonDioxide">
      <circle cx="0" cy="0" r="0.005" fill="#4fc3f7"/>
      <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.005" fill="black" dy="0.002" x="0" y="0">CO2</text>
    </g>
    <rect id="tissueCell" x="0" y="0" width="0.1" height="0.1" fill="#27ae60"/>
  </defs>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.05" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Capillary Exchange</text>

  <!-- Capillary -->
  <rect x="0.1" y="0.4" width="0.8" height="0.2" fill="none" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005"/>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.45" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Capillary</text>

  <!-- Tissue Cells -->
  <use href="#tissueCell" x="0.01" y="0.2"/>
  <text x="0.06" y="0.25" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tissue Cell</text>
  <use href="#tissueCell" x="0.01" y="0.7"/>
  <text x="0.06" y="0.75" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tissue Cell</text>
  <use href="#tissueCell" x="0.9" y="0.2"/>
    <text x="0.95" y="0.25" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tissue Cell</text>
  <use href="#tissueCell" x="0.9" y="0.7"/>
    <text x="0.95" y="0.75" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">Tissue Cell</text>

  <!-- Red Blood Cells -->
  <use href="#redBloodCell" x="0.1" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L 0.7 0"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#redBloodCell" x="0.15" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L 0.7 0" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
  <use href="#redBloodCell" x="0.2" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L 0.7 0" begin="2s"/>
  </use>

  <!-- Oxygen Diffusion -->
  <use href="#oxygen" x="0.3" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L -0.2 0" begin="0s"/>
  </use>
    <text x="0.25" y="0.5" text-anchor="end" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">O2 Diffusion</text>
  <use href="#oxygen" x="0.6" y="0.5">
    <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L 0.2 0" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
      <text x="0.7" y="0.5" text-anchor="start" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">O2 Diffusion</text>

  <!-- Carbon Dioxide Diffusion -->
  <use href="#carbonDioxide" x="0.1" y="0.2">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L 0.2 0.3" begin="0s"/>
  </use>
      <text x="0.2" y="0.4" text-anchor="start" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">CO2 Diffusion</text>
  <use href="#carbonDioxide" x="0.9" y="0.8">
    <animateMotion dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0 0 L -0.2 -0.3" begin="1s"/>
  </use>
        <text x="0.8" y="0.6" text-anchor="end" font-size="0.01" fill="#7f8c8d">CO2 Diffusion</text>
</svg>

rawActions.text: Location of baroreceptors sensing blood pressure.
Afferent signals transmit pressure information to the brainstem.
Efferent signals regulate heart rate and blood vessel constriction/dilation.
Increased pressure stretches the cell membrane, altering ion channel activity.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <g id="blood">
      <circle r="0.01" fill="#e74c3c"/>
    </g>
    <marker id="arrow" viewBox="0 0 10 10" refX="5" refY="5" markerWidth="5" markerHeight="5" orient="auto-start-reverse">
      <path d="M 0 0 L 10 5 L 0 10 z" fill="#2c3e50"/>
    </marker>
  </defs>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Vasomotor Control</text>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.15" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#2c3e50">Artery Diameter Changes</text>

  <!-- Normal Artery -->
  <g id="normal_artery">
    <rect x="0.1" y="0.2" width="0.8" height="0.2" fill="#f2f2f2" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005"/>
    <rect x="0.12" y="0.22" width="0.76" height="0.16" fill="#ffffff"/>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.28" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Normal Diameter</text>
    <text x="0.1" y="0.21" font-size="0.015" fill="#2c3e50">Vessel Wall</text>
    <text x="0.1" y="0.41" font-size="0.015" fill="#2c3e50">Smooth Muscle</text>
    <line x1="0.1" y1="0.4" x2="0.12" y2="0.4" stroke="#2c3e50" stroke-width="0.002" marker-end="url(#arrow)"/>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.25">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.3">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="0.5s"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.35">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="1s"/>
    </use>
    <text x="0.7" y="0.43" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Normal Flow Rate</text>
  </g>

  <!-- Vasoconstriction -->
  <g id="vasoconstriction">
    <rect x="0.1" y="0.45" width="0.8" height="0.2" fill="#f2f2f2" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005">
      <animate attributeName="height" values="0.2;0.15;0.2" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
      <animate attributeName="y" values="0.45;0.475;0.45" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
    </rect>
    <rect x="0.12" y="0.47" width="0.76" height="0.11" fill="#ffffff">
      <animate attributeName="height" values="0.16;0.06;0.16" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
      <animate attributeName="y" values="0.47;0.5;0.47" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
    </rect>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.53" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Vasoconstriction</text>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.5">
      <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.55">
      <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="1s"/>
    </use>
    <text x="0.7" y="0.68" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Decreased Flow Rate</text>
  </g>

  <!-- Vasodilation -->
  <g id="vasodilation">
    <rect x="0.1" y="0.7" width="0.8" height="0.2" fill="#f2f2f2" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005">
      <animate attributeName="height" values="0.2;0.25;0.2" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s"/>
      <animate attributeName="y" values="0.7;0.675;0.7" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s"/>
    </rect>
    <rect x="0.12" y="0.72" width="0.76" height="0.19" fill="#ffffff">
      <animate attributeName="height" values="0.16;0.24;0.16" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s"/>
      <animate attributeName="y" values="0.72;0.68;0.72" dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s"/>
    </rect>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.78" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Vasodilation</text>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.75">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.8">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="0.5s"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.85">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="1s"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#blood" x="0.15" y="0.7">
      <animateMotion dur="3s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.6" begin="1.5s"/>
    </use>
    <text x="0.7" y="0.93" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Increased Flow Rate</text>
  </g>
</svg>

stepAnalyses.stepDesc: Bringing it all together, we synthesize a masterfully integrated system. Understand how the rhythmic pump (heart), the adaptable network (blood vessels), and the transport medium (blood) work in concert with the lungs, kidneys, and nervous system to maintain 'homeostasis' – a stable internal environment. This unified understanding allows us to grasp the implications of common circulatory disorders: how 'hypertension' (chronically high blood pressure) strains the heart and damages vessels by altering pressure gradients, or how 'atherosclerosis' (plaque buildup) increases resistance and reduces blood flow, directly impacting organ function. Visualize the mechanics of medical interventions: how a 'stent' mechanically opens a constricted vessel, or how a 'bypass graft' surgically reroutes flow around blockages, all explained through the fundamental principles of flow, pressure, and resistance we've now mastered. The journey culminates in appreciating the elegant fragility and astonishing resilience of life's fundamental flow.

rawActions.text: Bringing it all together, we synthesize a masterfully integrated system. Underst
Blood Circulation in the Human Body
Simplified diagram of the circulatory system.
Blood filtration and waste removal in the kidneys.

rawActions.svgCode:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <g id="rbc">
      <circle r="0.01" fill="#e74c3c"/>
    </g>
  </defs>
  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Atherosclerosis: Blood Circulation</text>
  <g id="healthy">
    <path d="M 0.1,0.35 L 0.9,0.35" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.1,0.45 L 0.9,0.45" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Healthy Artery</text>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.4">
      <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.4">
      <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="1s"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.4">
      <animateMotion dur="5s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.8" begin="2s"/>
    </use>
  </g>
  <g id="plaque">
    <path d="M 0.1,0.65 C 0.3,0.67 0.7,0.67 0.9,0.65" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.1,0.75 C 0.3,0.73 0.7,0.73 0.9,0.75" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.2,0.65 C 0.3,0.68 0.7,0.68 0.8,0.65" fill="#f39c12" stroke="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.2,0.75 C 0.3,0.72 0.7,0.72 0.8,0.75" fill="#f39c12" stroke="none"/>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.6" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Plaque Buildup</text>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.7">
      <animateMotion dur="7s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.5"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.7">
      <animateMotion dur="7s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 H 0.5" begin="2s"/>
    </use>
  </g>
  <g id="reduced">
    <path d="M 0.1,0.85 C 0.3,0.87 0.7,0.87 0.9,0.85" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.1,0.95 C 0.3,0.93 0.7,0.93 0.9,0.95" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.01" fill="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.2,0.85 C 0.3,0.90 0.7,0.90 0.8,0.85" fill="#f39c12" stroke="none"/>
    <path d="M 0.2,0.95 C 0.3,0.90 0.7,0.90 0.8,0.95" fill="#f39c12" stroke="none"/>
    <text x="0.5" y="0.8" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Reduced Blood Flow</text>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.9">
      <animateMotion dur="10s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 C 0.2,0.05 0.3,-0.05 0.5,0"/>
    </use>
    <use href="#rbc" x="0" y="0.9">
      <animateMotion dur="10s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M 0,0 C 0.2,0.05 0.3,-0.05 0.5,0" begin="3s"/>
    </use>
  </g>
</svg>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<svg viewBox="0 0 1 1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="plaqueGradient" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="0%">
      <stop offset="0%" style="stop-color:#FFFF00;stop-opacity:1" />
      <stop offset="100%" style="stop-color:#FFA500;stop-opacity:1" />
    </linearGradient>

    <g id="stentSection">
      <rect x="-0.01" y="-0.005" width="0.02" height="0.01" fill="gray" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.001"/>
    </g>

    <g id="catheter">
      <rect x="0" y="-0.003" width="0.1" height="0.006" fill="black"/>
    </g>
  </defs>

  <!-- Title -->
  <text x="0.5" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.03" fill="#2c3e50">Coronary Stent Deployment</text>

  <!-- Constricted Artery -->
  <path id="arteryWallTop" d="M 0.1,0.4 C 0.2,0.35 0.3,0.35 0.4,0.4 L 0.6,0.4 C 0.7,0.35 0.8,0.35 0.9,0.4" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none"/>
  <path id="arteryWallBottom" d="M 0.1,0.6 C 0.2,0.65 0.3,0.65 0.4,0.6 L 0.6,0.6 C 0.7,0.65 0.8,0.65 0.9,0.6" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none"/>

  <rect x="0.35" y="0.4" width="0.3" height="0.2" fill="url(#plaqueGradient)" stroke="orange" stroke-width="0.003"/>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.3" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Constricted Artery</text>

  <!-- Stent and Catheter (Initially Collapsed) -->
  <g id="stentGroup" transform="translate(0.1, 0.5)">
    <g id="stentCollapsed" transform="scale(0.1, 1)">
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.02" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.04" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.06" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.08" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.1" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.12" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.14" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.16" y="0"/>
        <use href="#stentSection" x="0.18" y="0"/>
    </g>

    <use href="#catheter" x="-0.1" y="0"/>

    <animateMotion xlink:href="#stentGroup" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" path="M -0.1,0 H 0.4" begin="0s"/>
    
    <animateTransform xlink:href="#stentCollapsed" attributeName="transform" attributeType="XML" type="scale" values="0.1 1; 1 1; 1 1; 0.1 1" keyTimes="0;0.5;0.75;1" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" additive="sum" />
    
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="1;1;0" keyTimes="0;0.75;1" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s" />

    <text x="0.1" y="0.1" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Stent</text>
    <text x="-0.05" y="-0.02" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.015" fill="#7f8c8d">Catheter</text>
  </g>

  <!-- Expanded Artery -->
  <path id="arteryWallTopExpanded" d="M 0.1,0.4 C 0.2,0.3 0.3,0.3 0.4,0.4 L 0.6,0.4 C 0.7,0.3 0.8,0.3 0.9,0.4" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none" opacity="0">
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="0;1;1;0" keyTimes="0;0.5;0.75;1" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s" />
  </path>
  <path id="arteryWallBottomExpanded" d="M 0.1,0.6 C 0.2,0.7 0.3,0.7 0.4,0.6 L 0.6,0.6 C 0.7,0.7 0.8,0.7 0.9,0.6" stroke="#c0392b" stroke-width="0.005" fill="none" opacity="0">
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="0;1;1;0" keyTimes="0;0.5;0.75;1" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s" />
  </path>

  <g id="stentExpanded" transform="translate(0.5, 0.5)" opacity="0">
    <use href="#stentSection" x="-0.2" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="-0.16" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="-0.12" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="-0.08" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="-0.04" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0.04" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0.08" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0.12" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0.16" y="-0.005"/>
    <use href="#stentSection" x="0.2" y="-0.005"/>
    
    <animate attributeName="opacity" values="0;1;1;0" keyTimes="0;0.5;0.75;1" dur="4s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="0s" />
  </g>

  <text x="0.5" y="0.7" text-anchor="middle" font-size="0.02" fill="#7f8c8d">Restored Lumen</text>

</svg>

rawActions.text: High blood pressure is detected by baroreceptors.
Baroreceptor signals reach the medulla oblongata.
Medulla oblongata signals heart and blood vessels.
Reduced heart rate and vasodilation lower blood pressure.
The system continuously regulates blood pressure.
Blood Circulation: Healthy vs. Diseased Artery
The arterial wall is composed of three layers: tunica intima, tunica media, and tunica adventitia.
Atherosclerosis begins with the accumulation of lipids and inflammatory cells in the arterial wall, leading to plaque formation.
Hypertension leads to thickening of arterial walls and reduced lumen size, increasing blood pressure.
Diseased arteries restrict blood flow, leading to serious health problems.

architectureLimitations: Fallback patterns detected - NOT truly dynamic
finalVerdict: ⚠️  MOSTLY WORKING - Some issues need attention
